etymology.description: 紅(紅) (hóng, "red"), 菜(菜) (cài, "vegetable"), 頭(頭) (tóu, "head")
etymology.interpretation: The word combines 紅(紅) (hóng, "red"), 菜(菜) (cài, "vegetable"), and 頭(頭) (tóu, "head") to describe a red-colored vegetable that is bulbous, which accurately depicts the appearance of a beetroot. Beetroot is known for its red root, resembling a round or bulbous shape.

examples.chinese: 我喜欢吃红菜头(我喜歡吃紅菜頭)。
夏天来临时(夏天來臨時)，红菜头变得格外鲜艳(紅菜頭變得格外鮮豔)。
examples.pinyin: Xiàtiān láilín shí, hóngcàitóu biàn dé géwài xiānyàn.
examples.english: When summer arrives, the beetroot becomes exceptionally vibrant.

examples.chinese: 农田里种满了各种蔬菜(農田裡種滿了各種蔬菜)，红菜头也不例外(紅菜頭也不例外)。
examples.pinyin: Nóngtián lǐ zhòng mǎn le gèzhǒng shūcài, hóngcàitóu yě bù lìwài.
examples.english: The fields are filled with all kinds of vegetables, and beetroot is no exception.
